article_title: Volvo Uses Swedish Heritage to Pitch Its Cars
article_text:
Earlier this year, Volvo Car Corp. decided to rip a page from its history book and began touting in China a technology it designed a decade ago to keep birch-tree pollen out of the interior of its cars.

The move, a response to Chinese customers' worries about the horrendous air pollution affecting cities including Shanghai and Beijing, fits with Volvo's renewed focus on safety and Sweden's pristine environment, traditional marketing...

twitter.description: Chinese-owned auto maker is out to rebuild awareness in China and elsewhere by stressing its Swedish origins, offering cinnamon buns and installing Spotify's digital music service on its cars.
twitter.title: Volvo Trades on Swedish Heritage to Sell Cars

image.alt: Volvo's Marketing Pitch to China: Try a Cinnamon Bun
